title.narrative: Funding to Palestinian Auth through WB Trust Fund

description.narrative: The World Bank Palestinian Reform and Development Plan (PRDP) is a multi-donor trust fund that supports the Palestinian Authority to enhance state building, improve governance capacity and increase the efficiency of institutions to deliver effective public services to the Palestinian people. This investment closely aligns with the Palestinian Authority's 2017-22 National Policy Agenda: Putting Citizens First, which aims to provide all Palestinians with an improved standard of living, better services accessible to all and responsible, accountable, transparent public institutions. Australia contributions will support public financial management and help the Palestinian Authority to work towards fiscal stability. Our contributions towards functioning and viable Palestinian institutions also continues to support our long-standing support for the Middle East peace process. The total value of this investment is $10.0 million over 2 years, starting 2016-17.
